Comments_List: Music theory, composition with modern technology, and supercollider.

Basic music theory, how to think holistically about an algorithmic piece, LOTS of SuperCollider tricks, the beauty of stochastic processes combined with rules and sonification

I also learned a lot from the other students, who were very talented (particularly in their projects)

The course was well organized and delivered useful skills. Access to the studio was also great.

It's tricky because of the department, but I sometimes wished the instructor had brought more of his composer background to the lectures. I wanted to listen to more music in class and have it explained by an expert.

The algorithms were interesting, of course, but it wasn't an algorithms course and we didn't write any mathematics, so at times it just felt like a Wikipedia level introduction to, say, CFGs.
Yes, because it is a lot of fun.
